data.title: CSNY Deja Vu 50th anniversary reissue - May 14, 2021 *
data.meta_description: I enjoy this Crosby vs Nash & Young feud very much. I like drama, it keeps me interested. Drama is a part of CSN&Y history. I mean, Croz was a walking...
data.text:
Man, I love reading this. Mine is scheduled to arrive on Wednesday. I can't wait to hear the Bellman mastered LP. I've owned several versions of this on vinyl, and still have the following two:

1970 US Atlantic Records, Mastered by Al Brown and pressed at Monarch Records, with black faux cover: https://www.discogs.com/Crosby-Stills-Nash-Young-Déjà-Vu/release/10722495

1977 US Atlantic Records Reissue, Mastered by George Piros and pressed at Specialty Records Corporation, with faux brown leather cover: https://www.discogs.com/Crosby-Stills-Nash-Young-Déjà-Vu/release/4753808

To my ears, the George Piros cut sounds superior in all ways to the original US Al Brown cut version. I can't wait to hear the Bellman cut. From everything I read, it should beat the Prios cut. I actually bought this package just for the new vinyl pressing. The CDs will be a nice bonus, but the vinyl will get most of my listening time.

Susan Nash had obviously been part of CSN(Y)’s lives for some 40 years; Stills has spoken very highly of her and she was tight friends with Jan Crosby, so no doubt Nash’s behaviour didn’t go down well......Stills very very rarely comments publicly, to him it’s personal family stuff and no-one else’s darn business, but Croz and Nash slug it out in public......

Croz has never actually retracted what he said about Darryl Hannah- “I was wrong, Darryl is OK”- he said he shouldn’t have said it, he’s said he has no right in view of his own mistakes, but he’s never retracted it, and that isn’t lost on Young.....

IMHO Croz’s last four albums are WAY better than the last four CSN(Y) albums, and you don’t have to like Croz to agree....

They’re done. I wish it had been neater and cooler........

Right on

Very good point. This logic however, applies to both sides of the political spectrum depending on your point of view. In this case we know that Graham is a staunch progressive so this indeed could be a reason for his curmudgeonly behavior. I believe more on the lines that he is like most, a self centered, pampered rock star.

As I believe Nash and Crosby pointed out in the CBS interview, and as everyone has known for decades, Neil was never really fully on board with CSNY in 1969/1970, so it’s hardly surprising he would pull some of “his” songs from this set. He did Country Girl on his own and brought it in for the other guys to sing on. It is what it is, to Neil other people, from CSN to Crazy Horse, are there to be used and discarded according to his whims of the moment. If you admire him, he’s a courageous lone wolf, blah blah blah, if you don’t, he’s just kind of a very talented jerk. Of course, all four of them are very talented jerks, but Neil has always been in a league of his own in that regard.

Below is a list of original recordings, alternates, outtakes, and demos from Deja Vu sessions (roughly those that were recorded between 5/29/69- the release of Crosby, Stills and Nash- and 3/11/70- the release of Deja Vu) and where they appear. My sources are the Deja Vu boxset, the CSN boxset, the Carry On boxset, Reflections boxset, Over The Years, Replay, Crosby Stills and Nash (expanded edition), and Demos. I don't own Voyager or Archives Vol.1, so anything from those releases are missing. Additions and deletions are welcomed if anyone cares to review this.

Carry On- original release

Carry On- early alternate mix- new boxset

Carry On- alternate mix on Carry On

Carry On- Replay version

Teach Your Children- original release

Teach Your Children- early alternate version on new boxset

Teach Your Children- alternate mix on Reflections

Teach Your Children- demo with Crosby on Crosby, Stills, and Nash

Teach Your Children- Nash's solo demo on Over The Years

Almost Cut My Hair- original release

Almost Cut My Hair- early alternate version on new boxset

Almost Cut My Hair- demo- on new boxset

Almost Cut My Hair- 8:49 version on CSN

Almost Cut My Hair- demo on Demos

Helpless- original release

Helpless- harmonica version on new boxset

Woodstock- original release

Woodstock- alternate vocal on new boxset

Woodstock- 1969 alternate mix on CSN

Deja Vu- original release

Deja Vu- early alternate mix on new boxset

Deja Vu- demo on new boxset

Deja Vu- demo on Demos

Our House- original release

Our House- early alternate version on new boxset

Our House- demo #1 on new boxset

Our House- demo #2 (with Joni Mitchell) on new boxset

Our House- demo on Over The Years

4+20- original release

4+20- alternate take #2 on new boxset

4+20- demo on new boxset

4+20- alternate mix on CSN

4+20- previously unreleased mix on Carry On

Country Girl/Everybody I Love You- original release

Know You Got to Run- new boxset

Know You Got to Run- demo on new boxset

Everyday We Live- outtake on new boxset

The Lee Shore- outtake on new boxset

The Lee Shore- outtake from CSN

The Lee Shore- demo on Carry On

I'll Be There- outtake on new boxset

Bluebird Revisited- outtake on new boxset

Horses Through A Rainstorm- outtake from new boxset and same version on CSN

Horses Through A Rainstorm- demo on new boxset and same version on Over The Years

30 Dollar Fine- outtake on new boxset

Same Old Song- outtake from new boxset

Hold On Tight/ Change Partners- outtake on new boxset

Laughing- outtake on new boxset

Laughing- demo on new boxset

Right On Rock and Roll- outtake on new boxset

Everybody's Alone- outtake- UNRELEASED

Sea of Madness- outtake- UNRELEASED

Song With No Words (Tree with No Leaves)- demo on new boxset and same version on CSN

Song With No Words (Tree With No Leaves)- new remixed demo as a bonus track on Crosby, Stills, and Nash expanded edition

Birds- demo on new boxset

So Begins the Task/Hold On Tight- demo on new boxset

So Begins the Task (only)- unreleased demo from Carry On

Right Between the Eyes- demo on new boxset and same version on Reflections and Over The Years

How Have Yo Been- demo on new boxset

Triad- demo on new boxset

Question Why- demo on new boxset

She Can't Handle It- demo on new boxset

Sleep Song- demo on new boxset and same version on Over The Years and Demos

Helplessly Hoping- CSN&Y live in the studio on CSN

Do For The Others- bonus track on Crosby, Stills and Nash- expanded edition

Everybody's Talkin'- bonus track on Crosby, Stills, and Nash- expanded edition

Steve's Song outtake- UNRELEASED- is the the same song as Steve's Tune that became Know You Got to Run?)

CROSBY PUBLISHING DEMOS from new boxset booklet

all are unreleased as far as I know except Triad and Deja Vu which appear above as on the new boxset

Song With No Words, Almost Cut My Hair (2 versions), The Lee Shore (2 versions), Motherless Child, Everybody's Been Burned, Laughing, Kids, and Dogs, Dancer, Where Will I Be

STEPHEN STILLS DEMOS

all are unreleased except where noted

Round and Round (Do For Others)- UNRELEASED if not the same song that appears as Do For The Others on the expanded edition of Crosby, Stills, and Nash

Blackbird, Satisfied Mind, Everybody's Talkin'- UNRELEASED if not the same song that appears on the expanded edition of Crosby, Stills, and Nash

How Have You Been
